nodes.description:
# Specific:


# General:
In many cases, current data does not support the level of specificity that the full ontology allows, or the information is simply best expressed in human-readable form. For example, instead of a completely modeled set of parts with materials, many museum collection management systems allow only a single human-readable string for the "medium" or "materials statement".  Any time that there is a description of the resource, with or without qualification as to the type of description, then this branch can be used to record the descriptive text. See: https://linked.art/model/base/#statements-about-a-resource

# Arches Note:


* BranchId: la-statement
* FieldId:
nodes.name: Statement

nodes.description:
# Specific:


# General:
Every node should have a _label that provides a human-readable summary label for the node. This is intended not for end users, but for developers looking at the data. See:  https://linked.art/model/base/#core-properties

# Arches Note:


* BranchId: la-label
* FieldId:

nodes.name: Statement_language

nodes.description:
# Specific:


# General:
This branch allows the classifications themselves to be classified in order to know what sort of type it is, without recognizing all of them individually. This is important when the set of first degree types is not easily enumerable, such as classifications for the type of object or work.  See: https://linked.art/model/base/#types-of-types

# Arches Note:
Note that the metatype is hidden from view. Ensure that it has a default set when imported into another branch or model.

* BranchId: la-meta-classification
* FieldId:
nodes.name: Statement_type

root.description:
# Specific:


# General:
In many cases, current data does not support the level of specificity that the full ontology allows, or the information is simply best expressed in human-readable form. For example, instead of a completely modeled set of parts with materials, many museum collection management systems allow only a single human-readable string for the "medium" or "materials statement".  Any time that there is a description of the resource, with or without qualification as to the type of description, then this branch can be used to record the descriptive text. See: https://linked.art/model/base/#statements-about-a-resource

# Arches Note:


* BranchId: la-statement
* FieldId:
root.name: Statement
